com.gnahraf.io.store.table.del

Class DeleteCodec

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gnahraf.io.store.table.del.DeleteCodec
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MagicNumDeleteCodec

    public abstract class DeleteCodec
extends Object
    Abstract representation of a deleted row. This figures in a TableSet that supports deleting rows: in order to represent a deletion entry in a table that overrides (masks) another table that contains the to-be-deleted row, we concoct this abstraction. In particular, we don't want to stipulate ahead of time how a deleted row is encoded (for example, by using a special byte in the row): there should be many occasions where a certain value in a row would naturally represent a non-entry as a deleted entry.
    Author:
    Babak

    • Field Detail

      • NOOP

        public static final DeleteCodec NOOP
        Noop codec. Never considers anything deleted. Note markDeleted(ByteBuffer) throws UnsupportedOperationException.

    • Method Detail

      • isDeleted

        public abstract boolean isDeleted(ByteBuffer row)
        Tests whether the given row encodes the deletion of the row.

      • markDeleted

        public abstract void markDeleted(ByteBuffer row)
        Encodes a deletion marker in the given row. An implementation must be careful not to modify the key part[s] of the row. Put another way, the modification must not affect the rank of a row with respect to the table's row order.
